intro: Cryptantha piscoensis, commonly known as the Pisco cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Peru. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
